summary: The FOMC held rates at 3.50-3.75%. Two dissenting votes: Miran and Waller, both wanted a 25bp cut.
content: The January 28, 2026 FOMC meeting resulted in a hold at 3.50-3.75%. Two governors dissented: Stephen Miran (4th consecutive dissent, previously wanted 50bp cuts but this time wanted 25bp) and Christopher Waller (who last dissented in July 2025). Both wanted a quarter-point cut. The other 10 FOMC members approved the hold, including the four new rotating regional presidents (Hammack, Logan, Kashkari, Paulson).
